thread.title: Kate Ceberano forgives Qantas for jandal turfing
thread.title_full: Kate Ceberano forgives Qantas for jandal turfing

title: Kate Ceberano forgives Qantas for jandal turfing
text:
Kate Ceberano forgives Qantas for jandal turfing Last updated 09:02, October 7 2015 Kate Ceberano/Facebook 
Australian singer Kate Ceberano was asked to leave a Qantas lounge due to her inappropriate footwear. 
Her jandals were wrong, but Kate Ceberano has shown there are no hard feelings after Qantas staff told her to leave the airline lounge over her casual footwear. 
The Aussie singer, who says she has been a member of the airline club for 25 years, took to social media on Monday to vent her frustration. 
"Disappointed to be evicted from the Qantas Lounge after being a member since 1990 for wearing inappropriate footwear'? hahaha (new rules)" she wrote on her Facebook page. I respect the rules :) I love qantas X pic.twitter.com/We76OE63WK â€” Kate Ceberano (@KateCeberano) October 6, 2015 
After the incident, Ceberano, who sang in the original I Still Call Australia Home Qantas ad , showed there were no hard feelings, posting a photo on social media of herself in closed-toe smart platform heels, with three smiling Qantas staff. 
"I respect the rules :) I love qantas X" she wrote on Twitter. 
Qantas says it introduced tougher dress standards in its airport lounges in April in response to feedback from lounge members wanting existing guidelines applied more rigorously. 
"We reached out to members earlier this year to remind them of the dress standards and had a grace period up until April this year," a Qantas spokesperson said. 
"We completely understand that being declined at the door isn't a great experience, so this is a good opportunity to remind those wanting to use our capital city lounges of the dress code that applies."
